dcterms:creator: Richard Socher
Alex Perelygin
Jean Wu
Jason Chuang
Christopher D. Manning
Andrew Ng
Christopher Potts
dcterms:description: The sentiment analysis task in SST-2 assigns a binary sentiment (negative/positive) to a sentence mined from RottenTomatoes movie reviews. The corresponding counterfactuals are generated using the Polyjuice generator.
dcterms:title: Stanford Sentiment Treebank (SST-2)

dcterms:creator: Shankar Iyer
Nikhil Dandekar
Kornel Csernai
dcterms:description: In the QQP dataset, given a pair of questions, the task is to predict if they are semantically equivalent, hence marked as duplicate. The second question is modified by Polyjuice as per the templates used for the SST-2 dataset.
dcterms:title: Quora Question Pair (QQP)

dcterms:creator: Andrew L. Maas
Raymond E. Daly
Peter T. Pham
Dan Huang
Andrew Y. Ng
Christopher Potts
dcterms:description: The IMDB dataset consists of movie reviews labeled as positive or negative, used for sentiment analysis. The dataset is utilized to evaluate the robustness of models against counterfactuals.
dcterms:title: IMDB

dcterms:creator: Jianmo Ni
Jiacheng Li
Julian McAuley
dcterms:description: The Amazon dataset consists of product reviews used for sentiment analysis and recommendation systems. It is evaluated for robustness against counterfactuals.
dcterms:title: Amazon

dcterms:creator: Sara Rosenthal
Noura Farra
Preslav Nakov
dcterms:description: The SemEval dataset focuses on sentiment analysis in Twitter, providing a benchmark for evaluating sentiment classification models.
dcterms:title: SemEval (Twitter)

dcterms:creator: Nabiha Asghar
dcterms:description: The Yelp dataset consists of reviews used for predicting ratings on a scale of 1-5, utilized for sentiment analysis and recommendation tasks.
dcterms:title: Yelp Reviews
